definition: canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn

sentences.english: So, most people negotiate a loan , called a mortgage , with a bank .
sentences.chinese: 因而，绝大多数人与银行协商贷款，称为典质贷款。

sentences.english: the immortal man's mortgage can be a shortcut to resolve the food shortage.
sentences.chinese: 不朽之人的典质可以作为解决食品欠缺的捷径。

sentences.english: She left her watch as a pledge with the taxi-driver.
sentences.chinese: 她将手表留给出租车司机作为典质。

sentences.english: The immortal man's mortgage can be a shortcut to resolve the food shortage.
sentences.chinese: 不朽之人的典质能够作为办理食物欠缺的捷径。

sentences.english: He that hath wife and children hath given hostages to fortune;
sentences.chinese: 夫人之有妻儿也，不啻已向命运典质。

sentences.english: The property was pledged as security for loans.
sentences.chinese: 这地产被当作存款的典质。

definition: not even enough land to stand an awl (idiom); absolutely destitute
to estimate/to fine (archaic)/variant of 資|资[zi1]
movable property/money and belongings/non-real estate assets
